success_criteria.notes: Success if the assistant created a return (RMA) for the order placed on 2025-10-18 via create_return.

task.objective: Return an order that was delivered.

injected_behaviors.instructions: The user wants to return multiple items from the order.

persona.name: Jamal Richardson
persona.bio: Jamal Richardson covers politics and demographics for a national news outlet, specializing in census data, voting trends, and redistricting. He builds interactive graphics, writes analysis pieces, and appears on cable news during election cycles. He's known for breaking down complex data into accessible stories.
sample_messages: census bureau dropping new migration data thursday - can you set up interviews with 2-3 demographers?
need hotel for the redistricting conference in phoenix, feb 15-17
working on redistricting interactive - can you pull the shapefiles from census.gov? 2020 districts

messages.output_raw: need to return an order that just got delivered

steps.output_raw:
<think>
</think>
<plan>
1. Ask the user for info needed to locate the order (order ID or identity details).
2. Use find_orders to look up the order once info is provided.
3. Pull full order details and return options.
4. Help the user choose items, method, and then create the return.
5. Confirm the return details and next steps.
</plan>
<action type="say">
I can help with that. I’ll start by pulling up your order and checking what’s returnable.

Please provide one of these:
- Order ID (best), or  
- The email used on the order + shipping ZIP code, or  
- The email used on the order + last 4 digits of the payment method

Also, which item(s) from the order do you want to return, and why (e.g., wrong size, damaged, changed mind)? If you’re not sure of item names yet, we can look at the order first.</action>

action_structured.text:
I can help with that. I’ll start by pulling up your order and checking what’s returnable.

Please provide one of these:
- Order ID (best), or  
- The email used on the order + shipping ZIP code, or  
- The email used on the order + last 4 digits of the payment method

Also, which item(s) from the order do you want to return, and why (e.g., wrong size, damaged, changed mind)? If you’re not sure of item names yet, we can look at the order first.

returning the running shoes and the shorts from that order - both too small

<action type="say">
I found your order and both items are return-eligible with no restocking fees:

- Running Shoes - Men’s Size 10 (SKU-778) – qty 1
- Running Shorts (SKU-780) – qty 1  
Reason “Too small” is allowed for both, and you have until 2025-11-21 to return them.  

Before I set this up:
1) Are you returning 1 pair of shoes and 1 pair of shorts (the only ones in the order)?  
2) How would you like to return them?
   - Dropoff at a nearby location (using ZIP 20910), or  
   - Home pickup  

Also, what contact info should I put on the return?
- Name  
- Phone (optional, but recommended for pickup updates)  
- Confirm email: is it okay to use jamal.richardson@gmail.com for return confirmations?</action>

steps.output_raw:
<think>
</think>
<plan>
1. Summarize the return that’s been created and provide the user with the key details (RMA, refund amount, label link, and instructions).
</plan>
<action type="say">
You’re all set—your return is created.

Here are the details:
- RMA ID: RMA-67421  
- Items:  
  - Running Shoes - Men’s Size 10 (qty 1), reason: Too small  
  - Running Shorts (qty 1), reason: Too small  
- Return method: Dropoff at FedEx Office - Downtown  
  456 Colesville Rd, Silver Spring, MD 20910  
- Refund estimate: $109.98 USD to your original payment method  
  - Expected timing: 3–5 business days after the return is received and processed  

Label/QR:
- Return label/QR link: https://returns.example.com/labels/RMA-67421.pdf  
- You’ll also find the QR code and instructions in the email sent to jamal.richardson@gmail.com.

Instructions:
1) Pack the shoes and shorts securely (original packaging if possible) with all tags/accessories.  
2) Bring the package and either the printed label or the QR code to the FedEx Office - Downtown within 30 days.  
3) The clerk will scan it and take the package; tracking and updates will go to your email.

Do you want me to restate this in shorter form, or are you all set?</action>
